revised_title: Observations on Worms Whose Parts Live After Being Cut Asunder
tldr: Thomas Lord describes his observations of worms whose parts can live and regenerate after being cut asunder. He discusses his attempts to collect and study these worms, noting that some can survive for up to 48 hours after being cut. He also mentions the work of Dr. Mortimer and a French gentleman who discovered water-worms that could live after cutting.
